page.title: 03LIFE IN EAST LANGDON.
page.content: Village residents have noticed important changes since 1945. In particular the vilage has grown inspite of the fact that families are now much smaller. The number of farms has decreased from 3 to 2. This,with mechanisation and a change to live_ stock from arable farming,has led to fewer local people doing farm jobs. The fact that most families have a car enables them to get to work elsewhere. The village is quiet and the residents like the countryside and the people, but there is a feeling that the sense of community has declined. Village life still centres around the church and it's hall where Bingo is played. The local pub has closed but there are soccer and cricket teams. Best remembered events of the last twenty years include the Jubilee party and a visit by the Archbishop of Canterbury.
